text: Welcome! You are reading an in-progress version of the R for the Rest of Us handbook.

title: Welcome
text:
Our Work
The business has two main arms: education and consulting.

Education
On the education side, we offer:

Self-paced and cohort-based courses
In-person public workshops
Custom training for organizations



Consulting
On the consulting side, we do a range of projects. Almost all of them involve some combination of:

Data visualization
Using R to improve workflows
Automating reporting (especially with parameterized reporting)

title: Welcome
text:
Roadmap
As a business that does both education and consulting work, the R for the Rest of Us Roadmap is guided by internal and external factors. We do our best to be thoughtful about future directions we think are useful based on customer feedback while also leaving space to adjust based on new information.

title: Welcome
section: A Business with a Social Conscience
text:
A Business with a Social Conscience
R for the Rest of Us is not just a money-making enterprise. I also want it to be a business with a social conscience. We put this into practice by:

Highlighting important issues in the work we do (e.g. the types of projects we work on)
Making it possible for people of various means to learn R (through parity purchasing power and scholarships)
Donating a portion of revenue to organizations working for social justice

title: Email Automations
text:
Email marketing is the main way that R for the Rest of Us brings in revenue.
All external marketing is designed to get people onto the R for the Rest of Us email list. Once they’re on the list, we send them regular emails that educate them about R, interspersing emails that attempt to sell them on our offerings.
The specifics of how our email marketing system works comes largely from Brennan Dunn’s Mastering ConvertKit course. The process gets fairly complicated, but at the highest level, here’s what it does:
Below are details about how email automations work. Note that sequences aren’t included because they are generally just called from Visual Automations below.

title: Email Automations
text:
Email Journeys

Signup
Here are the journeys that experience on the R for the Rest of Us email list.

Getting Started Signup
If the user gets onto the list by signing up for Getting Started, they get the tag Purchased - Getting Started applied through the WooCommerce-ConvertKit integration.
They then go through the Getting Started - Signup - Automation. This does the following:

Assigns the tag Customer - Course/Workshop
Assigns the tag Customer
Assigns the tag Flag - Calculate Next offer (which sends them through the Function - Calculate Offer Funnel and Expertise Level - Automation)
Assigns the Flag - Remove from Shadow Newsletter tag, which does what it says
Puts them through the Getting Started - Signup - Sequence, which sends a set of emails about the course
When they complete the course or the Getting Started - Signup - Sequence, they get pulled to the end and go into the Fundamentals - Bridge - Automation

The Fundamentals - Bridge - Automation pitches people on Fundamentals. It happens in two ways depending on what the user has done so far on Getting Started.

If the user has the Completed - Getting Started tag, they go into the Fundamentals - Bridge - Hot. This goes straight to the pitch for Fundamentals.
If the user has not completed Getting Started, they go into the Fundamentals - Bridge - Cold. This sends them a few emails before pitching them on Fundamentals.

After they go through the bridge sequences, they go into the Fundamentals - Pitch - Automation.

The tag Flag - Pitch Window Open - Fundamentals gets applied. This triggers Zapier to create a personalized coupon on WooCommerce.
The user gets an email on Friday telling them their personal window is open to purchase Fundamentals.
The user goes through the Fundamentals - Pitch - Sequence, which sends an email every day the next week with info on purchasing Fundamentals.
The tag Completed - Onboarding is applied.
The tag Flag - Start Shadow Newsletter is applied. This triggers the Shadow Newsletter - Automation and adds them to the shadow newsletter.



Other Courses Signup

If they sign up for a course, each Woo products assigns them the appropriate tag (e.g. Purchased - Fundamentals).
Then, they go through a visual automation for each course (e.g. Fundamentals - Signup - Automation)
Then, this automation rule assigns them the tag Flag - New Subscriber.



R in 3 Months Signup

If they sign up for R in 3, WooCommerce assigns them the tag Purchased - R in 3 Months.

Then, they go through this visual automation, which takes them out of welcome sequences for Fundamentals and Going Deeper because they’ll get more personal emails. I also intentionally don’t assign them the tag Flag - New Subscriber because I want to handle the onboarding in a more personal way.



Newsletter signup
If someone signs up for the newsletter using this form, the following happens:

The Flag - New Subscriber tag is added to them through this automation rule

The Flag - New Subscriber tag puts them into the Global - Welcome - Sequence using this automation rule

The Flag - New Subscriber tag being added puts them onto the New Subscriber - Automation
The New Subscriber - Automation moves them through the Function - Calculate Offer Funnel and Expertise Level - Automation
The New Subscriber - Automation moves them through the Function - Tag Custom Training/Consulting Clients - Automation

If they are a custom training/consulting client, they get the Completed - Onboarding and the Flag - Start Shadow Newsletter tags applied, which moves them onto the shadow newsletter
If they are not a custom training/consulting client, they are moved to the Getting Started - Pitch - Automation (if they haven’t signed up for it)
